doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Inner Mongolia Yili - A Liquid milk sales decline narrows from 3.1 1Q25 to 0.8 2Q25 IMF ranking up to 1 top pick within _2025-08-31

passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be published, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.
nner Mongolia Yili - A
Liquid milk sales decliningharrows from \(3.1\%\) (1Q25) to \(0.8\%\) (2Q25); IMF ranking up to #1; top pick within our China dairy coverage

Yili's 1H25 reported earnings were down \(4.4\%\) yoy on sales up \(3.5\%\) yoy (outperforming Mengniu's reported earnings/sales \(- 16.4\% / - 6.9\%\) ). Stripping out mainly the asset disposal gain in 1H24, recurrent earnings increased \(31.8\%\) yoy (a beat; outpacing Mengniu's up \(12.2\%\) yoy). Raw milk cost declined \(2.5\%\) from Jan to Jun, and 1H25 average cost was down \(12\%\) yoy. This resulted in a \(2.1\%\) sales decline in liquid milk (vs Mengniu down \(11\%\) ; accounting for \(58\%\) Yili group sales). With IMF sales up DD (vs Mengniu up \(2.5\%\) and Feihe down \(9\%\) ), Yili is now ranked #1 in terms of IMF retail market share in China. Given the better-than- expected 1H25 results, Yili maintained its 2025 full- year target (announced at year- beginning) of sales up \(2.8\%\) (vs Mengniu down mid- high- single- digit) with a \(9\%\) net margin (up from 2024's adjusted net margin of \(8.2\%\) ). We maintain our 2025 sales/adjusted earnings forecasts of \(+2.9\% / + 20.6\%\) yoy, and our OW rating with a PT of Rmb35. Yili remains our top pick in our China dairy coverage.

What's good? 1) Fresh milk sales were up \(20\% +\) in 1H25 (vs Mengniu \(20\% +\) milk powder & cheese up \(14.3\%\) (vs Mengniu IMF/cheese up \(2.5\% /12\%\) ), and ice cream up \(12.4\%\) (vs Mengniu \(15\%\) ). 2) GP margin expanded 1.1ppt to \(36\%\) (vs Mengniu up 1.4ppt to \(41.7\%\) ) on easing input costs. 3) Selling exp/sales ratio was down 1.1ppt to \(18.3\%\) (vs Mengniu down 0.5ppt to \(27.9\%\) ). 4) OP margin expanded 2.4ppt to \(12.6\%\) (vs Mengniu 1.5ppt to \(8.5\%\) ). 5) Capex was cut by \(25\%\) yoy to Rmb1.45bn (vs Mengniu \(- 40\%\) yoy to Rmb1bn). 6) Committed to above \(70\%\) dividend payout (vs Mengniu \(50\%\) by JPMc) for 2025.

What's not good? 1) Liquid milk sales declined \(2.1\%\) yoy on flatish volume and a \(2\%\) ASP drop (vs Mengniu sales down \(11\%\) yoy on a \(6 - 7\%\) volume drop and a \(4 - 5\%\) ASP drop). This was mainly due to smaller brands gaining market share through irrational discounting on low raw milk costs (down \(12\%\) yoy). However, it's good to see the sales decline narrow from \(3.1\%\) (1Q25) to \(0.8\%\) (2Q25); 2) OpCF declined \(44\%\) (Yili attributes it to some customer advance being booked in Dec 2024 for the early 2025 CNY; vs Mengniu up \(46\%\) yoy).

2H25 outlook and guidance. 1) Yili expects its liquid milk sales to outperform industry growth in 2H25, and other segment sales to maintain similar momentum as in 1H25. With this, it expects to achieve its 2025 full year sales target of up \(2.8\%\) yoy to Rmb119bn; 2) Anticipating uncertainty in end- demand to remain in 2H25, Yili might have to invest more in selling expenses. However, it maintains a net margin target of \(9\%\) for full- year 2025 (vs 1H25 \(11.4\%\) ); and 3) Yili expects to gain market share in liquid milk in 2026.
Overweight 600887.SS,600887 CH Price (29 Aug 25):Rmb28.57 Price Target (Dec- 26):Rmb35.00

P/E30.316.815.314.0

We are OW on Yili, as we like its superior profitability and equity return profile. The top four senior management team members have a combined \(8\%\) equity holding (making them the second- largest shareholder after Hohhot Investment \([8.9\% ]\) ), aligning management's interest with that of public shareholders. Yili has best- in- class execution, but should reduce quarterly volatility and set higher ESOP KPIs, in our view. With a demand recovery (on normalized consumption sentiment and stimulus policies), we see an increasing probability of raw milk cost increase in mid- 2026, which would eliminate the existing irrational discounting activities by small milk companies, and hence, favour Yili's sales growth and margin. We forecast Yili's sales/ reported NP/adj. NP to grow \(2.9\% /33\% /21\%\) yoy in 2025E and grow \(4\% /9\% /8\%\) CAGRrs over 2025- 27.

Our DCF- based Dec- 26 price target of Rmb35 implies a \(18x / 17x\) 2026/27E P/E and \(2.0x\) 2026 PEG. We derive our \(9.0\%\) WACC for Yili assuming a 1.0 beta, \(3.0\%\) risk- free rate, \(7.0\%\) risk premium, \(10.0\%\) cost of equity and \(15\%\) optimal leverage. We assume a terminal growth rate of \(1\%\) .

We are OW on Yili, as we like its superior profitability and equity return profile. The top four senior management team members have a combined 8% equity holding (making them the second-largest shareholder after Hohhot Investment [8.9%]), aligning management's interest with that of public shareholders. Yili has best-in-class execution, but should reduce quarterly volatility and set higher ESOP KPIs, in our view. With a demand recovery (on normalized consumption sentiment and stimulus policies), we see an increasing probability of raw milk cost increase in mid-2026, which would eliminate the existing irrational discounting activities by small milk companies, and hence, favour Yili's sales growth and margin. We forecast Yili's sales/reported NP/adj. NP to grow 2.9%/33%/21% yoy in 2025E and grow 4%/9%/8% CAGRs over 2025-27.

Our DCF-based Dec-26 price target of Rmb35 implies a 18x/17x 2026/27E P/E and 2.0x 2026 PEG. We derive our 9.0% WACC for Yili assuming a 1.0 beta, 3.0% risk-free rate,7.0% risk premium, 10.0% cost of equity and 15% optimal leverage. We assume a terminal growth rate of 1%.

Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months.
